name: flightavailability
title: Google Flight Availability API

query.description:
Called by a partner: receives questions, each of which consists of one or
more segments, and returns answers with availability data.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

description: The Google Flight Availability API provides flight availability to partner airlines.

FlightavailabilityPartnerAvailQuestionsS.description: A flight segment, also known as leg.

departureDate.description: Departure date for this segment, in the time zone of the origin airport.

origin.description: Three-letter code of the origin airport.

bookingCode.description: Booking code, one or two letters.

destination.description: Three-letter code of the destination airport.

passiveSegment.description:
If true, then don't include an availability answer for this segment. The default is false (=include information). Useful for multiple segments with married availability, when it would only be desirable to expose availability from a few selected segments.

Note: Married availability refers to flight segments that are sold together based on origin and destination, but might not be available if you try to book them separately, segment by segment. For example, a routing from New York via Paris to Cairo might be available when you book a New York-Cairo flight, but an airline might restrict booking the two segments (New York to Paris, and Paris to Cairo) separately.

FlightavailabilityPartnerAvailAnswersEqu.description: A set of booking codes considered equivalent.

bookingCodes.description: Booking code, one or two letters.

FlightavailabilityPartnerAvailAnswersCon.description: Conditions or constraints that apply to a solution.

segmentIndices.description:
Zero-based non-negative index into the list of segments in the original
question.

answers.description: One-to-one mapping of answers to questions.

narrative.description: Consists of the sequence of calculations done to produce the questions.

FlightavailabilityPartnerAvailAnswersCon.description:
Condition or constraint that applies to a set of segments and has sets of
equivalent booking codes.

equivalentBookingCodes.description: Multiple groups if booking codes are to be treated as equivalent.

segmentIndices.description:
Zero-based non-negative index into the list of segments in the original
question.

parameters.description: Parameters that apply to all questions.

FlightavailabilityPartnerAvailAnswersAns.description: One answer to an availability question.

solutions.description: The answer. It consists of multiple solutions.

narrative.description: Consists of the sequence of calculations done to produce the answer.

foundNoSolution.description:
Set to true if no solution is found for the corresponding question.

Note: We return no solution if AVS returns an empty solution or reports an error for that question.

salesCrss.description:
Exactly 2 or 3 alphanumeric characters.
CRS stands for Computer Reservation System.

FlightavailabilityPartnerAvailQuestionsP.description: Location where the ticket is purchased.

FlightavailabilityPartnerAvailAnswersSol.description: One solution within an availability answer.

narrative.description: Consists of the sequence of calculations done to produce the solution.

constraints.description: All constraints that apply to a solution.

segmentCounts.description: A list of seat counts for one or more segments.

timestampTime.description: UTC timestamp that indicates when the solution was computed.

FlightavailabilityDate.description:
Represents a whole calendar date, e.g. date of birth. The time of day and
time zone are either specified elsewhere or are not significant. The date
is relative to the Proleptic Gregorian Calendar. The day may be 0 to
represent a year and month where the day is not significant, e.g. credit card
expiration date. The year may be 0 to represent a month and day independent
of year, e.g. anniversary date. Related types are google.type.TimeOfDay
and `google.protobuf.Timestamp`.

month.description: Month of year. Must be from 1 to 12.

day.description:
Day of month. Must be from 1 to 31 and valid for the year and month, or 0
if specifying a year/month where the day is not significant.

year.description:
Year of date. Must be from 1 to 9999, or 0 if specifying a date without
a year.

sameBookingCodes.description: Counts that are valid only when booking in the same BCs.

diffBookingCodes.description: Counts that are valid only when booking in different BCs.

FlightavailabilityPartnerAvailAnswersCon.description: Conditions or constraints that apply to a solution.

FlightavailabilityPartnerAvailAnswersSeg.description: A list of seat counts for a segment.

seatCounts.description: A list of seat counts for a segment.

narrative.description: Consists of the sequence of calculations done to produce the segment.

segmentIndex.description: Segment index in the original question.

FlightavailabilityPartnerAvailQuestionsP.description: Parameters upon which the questions should be answered.

seamlessAdjustment.description: Whether a PAORES-adjusted answer has been requested.

carrierPreferredAnswer.description: Indicates that answer should follow carrier preferred rules.

journeyDataSegments.description: List of segments provided as journey data.

bookingCode.description: Booking code, one or two letters.

journeyOriginCity.description: Three-letter abbreviation for the city where the journey originates.

segments.description:
List of segments to be queried for availability.

Note: No more than 10 segments per question is allowed.
